text: <extra_id_0> Tumor necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is a pluripotent activator of inflammation by inducing a proinflammatory cytokine cascade .

This phenomenon is mediated , in part , through inducible expression of the CXC chemokine , <extra_id_0> interleukin-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

text: In this study , we investigate the role of <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - inducible reactive oxygen species ( ROS ) in <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression by " monocyte-like " U937 histiocytic lymphoma cells .

text: <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a rapid activator of <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression by U937 , producing a 50-fold induction of mRNA within 1 hour of treatment .

text: In gene transfection assays , the effect of <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> requires the presence of an inducible nuclear factor-kappaB ( NF-kappaB ) ( <extra_id_0> Rel A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) binding site in the <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

<extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment induces a rapid translocation of the 65 kD transcriptional activator NF-kappaB subunit , <extra_id_0> Rel A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , whose binding in the nucleus occurs before changes in intracellular ROS .

text: Pretreatment ( or up to 15 minutes posttreatment ) relative to <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with the antioxidant dimethyl sulfoxide ( DMSO ) ( 2 % [ vol / vol ] ) blocks 80 % of NF-kappaB - dependent transcription .
Surprisingly , however , DMSO has no effect on inducible <extra_id_0> Rel A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding .

text: Similar selective effects on NF-kappaB transcription are seen with the unrelated antioxidants , N - acetylcysteine ( NAC ) and vitamin C .

These data indicate that <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces a delayed ROS - dependent signalling pathway that is required for NF-kappaB transcriptional activation and is separable from that required for its nuclear translocation .
Further definition of this pathway will yield new insights into inflammation initiated by <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signalling .
